body_html:
I believe the pattern of "one global collection for everything" has been abandoned some time ago, in favor of fewer collections, and generally a move aways from global objects and towards "layers as objects", with kernels/biases/activations being attributes of these objects.

You can retrieve kernels and biases from TRAINABLE_VARIABLES (they have different names indicating whether they are kernels or biases). To store activations when using functional layers, you should maintain your own dictionary of activations.

body:
I believe the pattern of "one global collection for everything" has been abandoned some time ago, in favor of fewer collections, and generally a move aways from global objects and towards "layers as objects", with kernels/biases/activations being attributes of these objects.

You can retrieve kernels and biases from `TRAINABLE_VARIABLES` (they have different names indicating whether they are kernels or biases). To store activations when using functional layers, you should maintain your own dictionary of activations.
